title.narrative: MONITORING & EVALUATION

description.narrative: Monitoring and Evaluation: The Government has a National Statistics Development Framework for improved child rights reporting and accountability., which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2023, government institutions at the national and regional level are routinely reporting on the realization of the rights of all children and adolescents .

sector.narrative: Building global / regional / national stakeholder evaluation capacity
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (early childhood nutrition)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Monitoring and Evaluation: The Government has a National Statistics Development Framework for improved child rights reporting andaccountability.

description.narrative: To ensure that programme monitoring remains consistent with UNICEF’s human rights-based approach and fosters social accountability, PME internal and external data functions gave clear;indications;of progress, or lack thereof, in the achievement of results. The information generated from various monitoring approaches is continuously;used to improve programme management,;strengthen national systems, and;increase positive impact on populations served. The following key monitoring frameworks are in place: ;1. Coherent framework for;monitoring of COVID-19 response;2.;Concept note for mainstreaming Accountability to Affected Persons (AAP) in Namibia CO and 3. Draft;National Monitoring and Evaluation Policy for Namibia is in place. All Staff went through orientation course on AAP. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2021
